summary: Information about whether and how well agencies are reaching their goals is essential to making the federal government more effective. This only works, however, when federal managers use that data to make decisions. Despite various efforts aimed at increasing managers’ use of data in decision making, our work has found little change over the past 20 years. The Office of Management and Budget has begun...
title: Managing for Results: Government-wide Actions Needed to Improve Agencies' Use of Performance Information in Decision Making
